projects.description: Student directory with site with information on 42 students. The site displays 9 students on any one page. The user is able to use the navigation/pagination buttons at the bottom of the page to look through the remaining students.They are then able to search through the students using the search bar at the top of the page. The site searches for students as each letter is being typed by the user. The page numbers update according based on how many results are returned.

Interactive form for users to register for a Full Stack Conference. The site validates user input, providing helpful error messages when the user enters invald information into the form fields. The price of selected events is totalled up and display and the user is prevented from selecting two activities that are at the same day and time. The form will also fail to submit if the correct information isnt entered.

Guess the movie quote app. Users can guess from 5 famous movie phrases. The user is able to click on each letter on the onscreen key board and the corresponding correct letter will appear in the phrase above and the key will then become disabled. If the letter guessed is incorrect then the user will lose a life, represented by hearts at the bottom of the screen. Key up event listener has also been added, so the user can use their keyboard to guess the letters too. Either a 'Sorry, you lose' page or 'Congratulations, you win' page will be displayed, depending on the result of the game.

Employee directory displaying 12 random employees generated using a Public API request. The user is able to click on each employee to display more information on a modal window. A search bar has been added to allow the user to search through the employees.

Site displaying 8 quotes from comedians at random. As well as being able to click, to refresh the quote, the quotes also automatically refresh every 4 seconds. The background colour of the site also changes to a random colour each time the quote is refreshed, whether it be manually or automatically.
